adjective.description: Skilled in a language or languages; (also occasionally) versed in the language of a particular discipline.
Having or speaking a language; (also) expressed in language of a particular kind. Chiefly with modifying word, as "new-languaged", "poorly languaged", etc.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in Robert Mannyng (d. c1338), poet and historian. From language + -ed. In later use also partly from language + -ed.
